list.item: ACT I .— Karl Mahler 's Studio , Vienna . ( Afternoon . )
ACT II .— Conservatory Reception Room at the Hofmanns ’ . ( Evening . )

ACT III .— At Karl 's Studio . ( The next morning . ) STAGE DIRECTIONS Up . away from audience Down . toward audience Up C. centre of stage , away from audience R. right of stage L. left of stage C. centre of stage R. C. to right of centre L. C. to left of centre

div.head: ACT I

stage.stage: SCENE .— Room next to KARL 'S studio . At the back of the stage to the L. is a glass door with portiere towards the stage . When this door is opened one can see the studio . Bach of the stage to the R. a fireplace with burning fire . Round the fireplace an elevation about half a yard high reaching into the middle of the room . This elevation is bordered by a wooden railing with an opening on each side — in the middle of the railing an ancient Gothic chair , with back towards the public ; the back of the chair must be so high that a person sitting in it cannot be seen by the public . On the R. a door leading into the entrance hall of the apartment . There is a little invisible door covered as the rest of the room , with wall paper , on the L. near the footlights . About a yard from this door , a settee with the head end towards the glass door of the studio . Next to this settee a small , ancient table , about one yard high . On the L. a curio cabinet ( small ) ; next to it a hall stand with some shawls of different colors . On L. next the settee a large , gilded , stand-up candelabra , as used in churches .

There are many sketches , framed and unframed , about the room — some statues , some heads , and a very elegant electric candelabra hanging in the middle of the room . The whole thing unharmonious but artistic . Down stage on the R. a medium-sized table littered with books , magazines and bric-a-brac ; a large palette lies on the top of some books and scattered among the other things some tubes of paint and paint brushes .

div.stage: When the Curtain rises the stage is empty for a few minutes .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , comes in with hat and overcoat which he takes off Heinrich ! Heinrich !

div.stage: HEINRICH , coming from studio .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Where were you ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Nowhere , sir .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: The door is wide open ; anybody could have walked in .HEINRICH goes into the studio and comes out with a velvet house-jacket . Calling after him :Where 's today 's paper ?He finds the newspaper .Well , hurry up .

div.stage: HEINRICH comes back and helps KARL put on his jacket .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , lights a cigarette Did you take my dress suit to be pressed ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Yes , sir : he will bring it back in an hour .

div.stage: Starts R .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Good ! Here 's a crown . Get me a white tie , same as the last one .HEINRICH starts R .Hold on ! Put out a dress shirt on the bed , then look for my pearl buttons — they are probably in the top drawer — in a match-box . Stop ! Give me that crown . Take this .Gives him a bill .Get me a pair of white gloves , seven and a half . Oh ! and Heinrich , before you go , put the Venetian chair next to the window . At three o'clock Mrs. Zanden will be here to have her portrait painted , and I shall be at home to nobody .Reclines on the settee .Give me an ash tray .HEINRICH gives it to him .All right ; go along .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Beg your pardon , sir —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , seated on couch L . What is it ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Mimi is here .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Where ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Waiting in the studio .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , indifferent , reading newspaper Send her away .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: , goes to the glass door Fraeulein , Herr Marler does not need you today .

div.stage: Exit L .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , coming in Hallo .KARL is silent , continues reading his paper .MIMI comes down L .Do n't you want to work today ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No .

div.stage: Continues reading paper .
HEINRICH goes into the studio .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , in bad humor , crosses to C . Good-bye .Turns around .And tomorrow ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , sad Good-bye .Wipes her eyes .You do n't love me any more ... you do n't love me any more .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Oh ! It 's going to start again !

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Ever since last fall you 've been different . I knew it right away when you started to paint landscapes . When you are in love you paint Venuses . I know what it means when you start to paint trees .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You 're silly , Mimi .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I know it . With her hat and coat on every model is silly .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Go home , Mimi .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , goes to head of couch Yes , yes . Go home ! Be a good girl . For a week now you 've sent me home without my even taking my gloves off . I 'm no use any more .Begins to cry but stops it at once .Look here : I know everything .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Really ?

lg.stage: From behind him , raises his head .
lg.l: Look at me ! Look at me ! You want to get married ? Tell me

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , comes to L. of him Oh , you tell me anything you want to my face ; but I know you 're going to marry a girl named Elsa — the wife of your friend Mr. Zanden has arranged everything — look at me and deny it , if you dare . After all , what 's the use ! you would n't tell me the truth anyway .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You little mind-reader .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: She 's a nice one , Mrs. Zanden ! Instead of taking you on herself , she marries you to a friend of hers . But I do n't care ; you do n't love me any more — doing landscapes all the time .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Well , what do you want ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , crosses to R. of him and kneels Tell me you do love me .Pouting .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , bored Yes , yes — of course .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , imitating him Yes , yes , of course . Is that the best you can do ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Well , what shall I say ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Oh ! You painters ! It 's always the same . First you say : “ What an angel ! What a Madonna ! What a Venus ! What color ! What hair ! What lines ! ” Then all of a sudden , it 's : “ Oh , my dear ! Why , you 've gone yellow . ” The next day you 're green , and then it 's : “ I have no time today . ” And , first thing you know , you 're — pooh ! Landscapes .Scornfully .She goes to him above table at head of couch , takes his head in her hands .Do n't you like me ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , smiling Why , yes .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: If you were really nice , you would at least promise to marry me . All the other artists promised . They were n't so mean as you are ! Oh yes , I know I am annoying you . I 'm absolutely boring you .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Reaches up and draws her down to him . — I would have done with you a long time ago .If you were not such a dear little nuisance —Kisses her .And now , run away , little girl : go home .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Do n't you want me tomorrow ? or the day after tomorrow ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , crossing to him at couch You will never have me pose any more for you at all ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , rises ; crosses with her to door R . I 'll look in on you this evening on my way to the Zandens ’ .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: But you can n't work in my house . I 've only a lamp !

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Ha ! Ha ! Ha ! Well , we 'll put that out !

div.stage: Has taken her to the door .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Bye , bye !MIMI exits .Lights another cigarette — the bell rings sharply . Calls , somewhat excited .Heinrich ! Heinrich !

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: , comes in from studio Yes , sir .

div.stage: Runs through the door on the R ., which he leaves open , and goes off to open the hall door .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Fixes his tie nervously , puts away newspaper , puts out his cigarette in ash tray , and arranges his hair . He goes towards the door through which HERMAN and OLGA enter , HEINRICH closes the door from the outside , KARL bows .Madame !

div.stage: Bows silently to HERMAN .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , in a hurry I only came to bring Olga , my boy : I must go back at once .

div.stage: OLGA has been looking around .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , going to C. and over to L . So this is the famous studio .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , looking around Funny , is n't it ? More like a junk shop .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: We might have chosen another day to begin Olga 's portrait — we have waited six years , so we could just as well have waited until tomorrow ; but the preparations for tonight 's ball made Olga so nervous that I thought it best to bring her here . You know this ball is a kind of house-warming .

div.stage: Crosses over to C .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: We were obliged to invite such a lot of people , to clear off our social obligations .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: I wish it was over . I hate these functions . Old Freebody , in whose business I started , was worth ninety millions , and he never gave a party in his life — or anything else , for that matter . When do you want me to call for Olga ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , R. C . Well , it gets dark very early now : in three quarters of an hour we wo n't be able to see any more .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Well , then —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , looking at his watch Let 's say four o'clock .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , after looking at a picture L. very closely Who is that ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Oh , some model .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Was n't that the girl we just met on the stairs ?

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: crosses quickly to L . I must have a look at her .Looks at picture .OLGA stands so as to hide picture .Oh , better not .Makes a gesture as if he had seen something indecent .Well , every minute counts — I must be off .Shakes his finger at KARL .You 'll have to stop that sort of thing , now , Karl . You know you are one of the reasons of tonight 's ball . Is n't he , Olga ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Yes — tonight Karl is to fall in love with his future wife .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , goes L. C . I shall do my best .To HERMAN .Sentenced to marry ! Well , I 'm prepared to meet my doom .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , seated on couch , with a little sigh At last ! I shall be glad .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: So shall I . So will the girl . So will Karl .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I hope so . She 's a charming girl .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Wait till you —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I know — I know . I shall adore her . But I have till this evening , you know .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , crossing to OLGA Well , I 'm off . My agent may telephone any minute .He kisses OLGA 'S hand .I shall call for you at four o'clock , my dear . And do n't worry about tonight : the caterer has his instructions .

div.stage: Crossing to R ., shaking hands with KARL , who holds him back .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , shaking HERMAN 'S hand Are n't you afraid to leave your wife ?

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Shall I tell you the truth ? I 'm hurrying because I 'm afraid of changing my mind and taking Olga away with me .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: You 're not jealous ?

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , at door If I was n't afraid of appearing ridiculous , I would say : Be good ! And now , good-bye .

div.stage: He goes off , KARL bringing him to the door of entrance hall .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Coming back , closes the door , stands still for a minute — when he comes back , OLGA shivers slightly and touches her forehead with her hand .Crosses to L. C. by OLGA .What is it ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , with a nervous , soft laugh Nothing — nothing at all .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , tenderly Are you frightened ?OLGA does not answer .Tell me .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , nervous , confused , as if she was afraid of him I do n't know , but — I feel as if — as if —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , trying to laugh , but very nervously I had the same feeling once in Dresden , when my mother took me to a boarding-school and left me there . I felt as if I were quite alone in this wide , strange world — and now — you know yourself . I have fought against coming here for six years .Looks around .KARL crosses C. and up laughing . Strange monsters , cut off heads , and you in the middle of all this like a wizard . While my husband was here I did not feel it , but now these heads seem to stare at me .What a queer place . I do n't think I like it .

div.stage: She shivers .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Do n't be nervous — every woman I paint comes here .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , seated on couch , quietly And do you paint every woman that comes here ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No .

div.stage: Silence .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Did you understand my husband just now ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I think I did .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: He has often pretended to be jealous , but this time there was a ring in his voice that made me feel that there was something behind it .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You do n't really think he 's jealous ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , crosses to chair No . But this is the first time I 've been alone with you .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Now we can talk things over . I 've wanted to for a long time .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , leans against R. back of chair We 've done well to avoid it all these years . A good conscience is like a warm bath — one feels so comfortable in it .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Last Thursday , when we spoke about my painting your portrait , you seemed embarrassed .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , looks at him ; their eyes meet Do n't let us talk about it . I do n't want to .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Do n't be afraid of me . If I were not I , your fear might be justified ; but as it is , surely we can trust ourselves to talk things over quietly . To think that seven years ago I was a teacher in Herman 's family — and I was there the day your engagement was announced — it was the evening of the day we —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , puts her hand on his , softly reproaching him Karl .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: — We kissed each other for the first time . Oh , I know . I was only a drawing teacher — but you — what were you ? Just a poor little friend of Herman 's sisters . Sometimes you were asked to tea in their grand house . And there we met — a beggar boy and a beggar girl at the rich man 's table . Do you wonder ? And then , just as we realized what we were to each other , one fine day Herman up and proposed to you . Such a dazzling offer — who could blame you ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , hurt Please — please , Karl .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: We were two poor little souls who found one another in the wilderness of wealth — only to lose each other . Even the memory of that one little kiss ....

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Dear Karl , do n't . We have grown up to be sensible people — we have put it out of our thoughts .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Oh , I know it 's all over . To-day I 'm —humorouslythe famous painter , your husband is my friend , and though we see one another every day , we have never spoken of it again . I would n't even have the courage to ask you to sit for your portrait . I was afraid , and I think you were afraid . And so was your husband . And that is why until this day —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , steps down one pace from chair , gives him her hand You are a real friend .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , goes to her , gently There 's nothing to be afraid of .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Oh , it was only my husband 's voice — something in his manner that frightened me . He must know what we were to one another , though he has never made the slightest allusion to it , not one single word in all these years . But when he left us here alone , he seemed to feel —Breaks off .But there is no reason for it , is there ? We are not in love with one another , are we ? And it 's just lovely to think that we have not entirely forgotten old times . Do n't you think so , Karl ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , goes to chair Of course I do .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Because if we still loved one another , you would not marry , would you ?

div.stage: Taking off gloves .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Of course not .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: So you will be married and you will be very , very happy — and I shall be happy , too , because it is my own idea , and I have picked out a nice girl for you — pretty and clever —KARL bows silent acquiescence .And now —Goes up and knocks on back of chair — business of entering imaginary door , etc . She speaks in an everyday voice , in marked contrast to former tone .How do you do , Professor ? I have come to have my portrait painted .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , quite enthusiastic , R. C . Last night I made a sketch of you from memory .... Oh , I 've made lots of sketches of you ; but now , now I see you in another light .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Yesterday I looked upon you as a model . To-day you are a motif — you are a revelation ...? there is something in your eyes ....

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Please , please , Karl , we agreed that — that —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Pardon me , I 'll try to remember .

div.stage: Goes up on platform .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Let 's go to work now — it 's getting late .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Whenever you are ready —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: What am I to do ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , steps behind her to take hat pins out of her hat Take off your hat and your coat , please .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Thanks , I can do that myself .

div.stage: She takes her hat and coat off . KARL takes her coat up on platform .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , passing her chair as he goes up Do you use perfume in your hair ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I ? Never !

div.stage: At chair up in alcove .

lg.l: Oh , then it is the natural perfume of your hair .
Pardon me : I stood too near .

div.stage: Looks at her in silence . She crosses back of large chair to couch L ., and sits facing audience .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , nervously , turns her head to him What is it ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , leaning against big chair , looking at her dress I was just thinking — did n't your husband say an evening frock ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Yes . Herman wants me painted decolletee — in an evening gown ; just a head and shoulders , you know . I would have preferred a street dress .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I 'm afraid I agree with Herman on that point . But have you ?... Did n't you ?... Where is the dress ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Oh , I thought you would only be painting my face the first sitting .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , comes C ., laughs So you thought I began at the top of a portrait and painted down ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , hesitating Yes .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Why , the drawing of the shoulders is almost more important than the head in the first sketch .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Oh , dear . How stupid of me .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , crossing L . I 'll tell you what —He selects some draperies from those hanging in the corner .I have some draperies here —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Well —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You can arrange one of these around your shoulders like — like an evening gown .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , mechanically Yes .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , hanging drapery on cabinet L . You will have to be quick because it will soon be dark . Here are the draperies — you 'll find some pins over here , and I 'll go into the studio while you — until you —

div.stage: Goes to door of studio .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , seated Until when ? Why ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Why , if I 'm to paint your shoulders — well —Turns away towards studio .— your blouse ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , terribly embarrassed Of course —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Do just as if you were at home . I 'll close this door .Goes to door R. to entrance hall and locks it .And now I 'll go into the studio ... and you can lock this door yourself .He has opened the door of the studio and has made one step into studio , and now says in a low tone :Oh ! It 's snowing .

div.stage: He looks at Olga .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Snowing ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Snowing hard .

div.stage: Silence .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Had n't we better ?— perhaps — perhaps — tomorrow — or — or —She has been saying this very slowly , as if afraid , but now suddenly regains confidence , as if she had had a saving idea .Tomorrow I could bring my maid .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Oh , no , no . Your husband would certainly want to know the reason , and really — if this door is closed —He goes back to his studio .It 's too bad ! This snow takes all the light away . But never mind — never mind ; the snow shovellers will be glad of it .

div.stage: He has spoken the last few sentences in a very low voice , as if the situation was painful to him . He goes backwards into the studio and now closes the door . [ OLGA is standing with her back towards the studio , staring in front of her . She now shrinks together , shivers , turns around . Sudden resolution , she turns the key , locking the door to the studio . Slowly unbuttons her blouse , looks at the shawls , of which she chooses one , afterwards takes her blouse off quietly , putting the shawl around her shoulders . She has put the blouse on the settee before she arranges the shawl . She now picks up the blouse and wants to put it on the chair in front of the fireplace ; her arm is already stretched out when she suddenly drops the blouse , utters a suppressed shriek , dropping blouse by chair , and crosses quickly to foot of couch .

The DEVIL , in fashionable frock coat , a crimson carnation in buttonhole , a man of from thirty-five to thirty-eight years old , resembling in face classical Mephisto , very elegant , picks up the blouse and offers to OLGA in a most polite manner .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Pardon , Madame .Comes C. a little .I think you dropped something .OLGA takes the blouse mechanically and looks at him frightened .I must beg your pardon , Madame . I came from lunch . Karl was not at home . I waited and I fell asleep in this very comfortable chair .He rubs his eyes .Forgive me , Madame , for opening my eyes at a moment when , for propriety 's sake , I should have at least kept one eye shut .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , puts blouse on couch and goes L ., horrified and disgusted Oh !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , Right of couch L . I am aware this is a base insinuation — of course you only come here —

div.stage: Ironical .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: To have my portrait painted .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I once had a similar encounter at a dentist 's ; and the lady , to prove that my insinuations were false , did not hesitate to sacrifice a perfectly good tooth .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I tell you , I —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , very polite Oh , I know — you speak the truth . I am even at liberty to believe it , though your truth is only partly in style . Truth should have nothing on at all , you know .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: The insolence ! What right have you to speak to me ? Who are you ? What are you doing here ? Karl !KARL tries door outside .Karl !

div.stage: She opens the door of the studio , KARL appears on the threshold and looks surprised at the DEVIL .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , crosses up R. C. very quickly How do you do ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , taken aback How do you do ?— er — how are you ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , quickly You do n't seem to remember me — we met at Monte Carlo —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , up L. C . Oh , yes .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Quite an eventful day it was .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , comes down a little Yes , yes , I remember . It was last fall , and I had just lost all my money at roulette . As I turned from the table , I caught sight of a stranger frowning at me .Pointing to DEVIL .It was you . I was startled , because only a moment before I had seen you next to the croupier , and I thought I heard you laugh when I lost . But now I remember — you stood behind me , and when I had lost everything , you offered me , a total stranger , a handful of louis d'or .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You refused — beggingly .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Yes , but —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , continuing You took them — protestingly .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: In five minutes I had won everything back , and 20 , 000 francs besides . Your gold seemed to have magic power , I remember . When you gave it to me it seemed to burn .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: But you paid me back and invited me to supper . I had to refuse , because I was obliged to leave for Spain the same evening , but I promised to look you up the next time you needed me —Crosses to R .and here I am .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Well , I 'll be —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , interrupting quickly Do n't mention it . I took a little nap in your chair .

div.stage: Goes up to back of big chair .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , goes C ., pointing to big chair . Frightened It 's very strange — this chair was empty ; there was nobody there .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , stepping towards her , bowing ; in a tone allowing no contradiction Then I was mistaken , Madame .

div.stage: OLGA goes over behind couch L. Silence .
OLGA and KARL look at the DEVIL suspiciously .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , L. C ., embarrassed Wo n't you please sit down ? Allow me to introduce you . I quite forget your name ....

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , R. C . Call me anything you like : we only call names when the party is absent ; but I am here now — call me Miller , or Brown , or Black .Start from KARL . DEVIL stops him .If you think Doctor sounds better , why not call me Doctor Miller ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , very much embarrassed Doctor Miller —Crosses to R. C. The DEVIL kisses OLGA 'S hand devoutly at foot of couch .Under ordinary circumstances , I should now take my hat and leave ;Goes up C .; turns .but my infinite tact compels me to force my presence upon you in this disagreeable situation .

div.stage: Sits down in chair C .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , crossing to KARL ; to the DEVIL How dare you ! Karl ! This man has the insolence to —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , seated C. Very quickly Your husband has been dead some time ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , very quick Oh , divorced ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Well , if you think that I have insulted you , I should say the proper person to refer me to would be your husband .Rises ; to KARL :Of course , if you wish , I am at your disposal also .To OLGA :But , Madame , this would be admitting —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What 's it all about ? I do n't understand you . You come in here , I do n't know how or where from , and you — you act as if you had trapped us —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , goes to KARL R. C . The idea !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Say what you like : I cannot go .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Why not ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: If I were to go now , it would be as much as to say : “ Pardon me , I fear I intrude . ” But if I remain , I show that I suspect nothing .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: We do n't need your assurance .

div.stage: OLGA crosses to L. below couch .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , bows politely ; embarrassing silence Suppose we talk about something else . I think we are in for a snowstorm .Standing R. of studio door . Silence .OLGA stands near the door leading to the studio , quite astonished .Are you sending anything to this year 's exhibition ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , uncomfortable Perhaps — I may send something .

div.stage: Silence . The DEVIL lights a cigarette at table L. C .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , puffs cigarette . On second puff Permit me , Madame .OLGA , picking up blouse , as if suddenly awakened and realizing her position , goes into the studio , closing the door behind her .Full of temperament — full of temperament . And pretty , too .

div.stage: KARL starts to light cigarette at table L. C .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , dropping cigarette , crosses to chair up C ., sits and looks at the DEVIL without speaking

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Too bad she does n't love her husband .KARL turns quickly towards the DEVIL . Quick :How do I know ? The way she turned to you just now when she fancied herself insulted — it did n't escape me .KARL takes up the ash tray and throws it angrily on table .No ; she does n't love her husband . He must be either a genius or a very common man . Marriage with them is always unlucky . Believe me , common men live so low that women are afraid somebody will steal in at night through the window which they forgot to lock . And Genius , well ! That lives on the top floor — so many stairs , no elevator . Her ideal is —A motion of the hand , wanting to express an even , middle position .— the second floor .KARL looks impatiently at his watch and goes towards the door of the studio . The DEVIL leans back blowing the smoke of his cigarette , indifferently .This is the second time I have seen her shoulders .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , coming down left of couch What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: The first time I saw them was in Paris —Start from KARL .at the Louvre — only they were on the Aphrodite . Am I right ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , crossing to large chair R. C. In bad humor How should I know ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , lifting himself upright , cynically Which shoulders have you not seen ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , angry I 've seen the Aphrodite .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , seated on couch Well , you may take my word . I have seen them both . And , believe me , since Alcamenes , I have only known one sculptor who could model such shoulders .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Who 's that ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Good living . Such tender , soft lines are only possible for a woman who lives exquisitely well . I take it she is the wife of a millionaire ?KARL goes again towards door of studio impatiently .Is she dressing ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , nervously I suppose so .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Is there a looking-glass in your studio ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , comes down L. of couch Yes .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: She must be very respectable .KARL looks at him astonished .If a lady takes as long as that to dress before a looking-glass , she 's not a — model — anyway .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , crosses around foot of couch to table L. C . Look here ! I think your remarks are , to say the least , in very bad taste .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , standing erect Do you mean that ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , aggressively I do .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , patting KARL 'S cheek Then you must be respectable , too .Crosses to big chair , KARL stares at him astonished .In a situation like this , only a very respectable man can be so infernally stupid .

div.stage: KARL crosses to R. OLGA opens door of studio , goes towards KARL without looking at the DEVIL , who is hidden in chair .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , dropping shawl on couch What 's the time ?

div.stage: Crosses to KARL , R .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , looking up over back of chair He 'll be here in ten minutes .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , angry Who ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Your husband .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Oh ! So you were n't asleep after all .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Oh , yes , I was .Rises .But “ What 's the time ? ” always means the husband . A woman 's intuition invariably anticipates her husband 's coming by ten minutes . If it was n't for that ten minutes , there would be more divorced women —He goes and unlocks the door of the hall .— and less locked doors .

div.stage: KARL crosses to L. C .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , taking her hat Will this never stop !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I tried to change the subject . I started to speak about the weather — the Exhibition — but Karl would n't have it .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Karl !

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I ? I have n't said a single word .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , crosses to big chair But your actions fairly shouted . The way you jumped up , looked at your watch , went to the door —To OLGA :He was afraid , the poor fellow .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Afraid of what ?

div.stage: L. C .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to OLGA That your husband would come before you had finished dressing . I do n't blame him .

div.stage: Goes up to hat .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Come now ! Let us be logical — let us look the situation in the face . Enter your husband —OLGA comes down R .“ Well , here I am : where is the picture ? ” “ The picture ? ”Shrugs his shoulders .“ There is no picture . Karl has n't even touched a brush . ” Your husband is astonished — he tries to speak — the words stick in his throat — he gasps : “ Well , if you did n't paint , why is she dressing ? ” Imagine the situation ! You look at one another horribly embarrassed ; Karl stammers something , but that only makes it worse . Nothing has happened — and yet the mischief is done . What mischief ? Appearances — appearances . They 're like fly-paper . There 's no getting away from them .Speaking to OLGA :You go home with your husband , and he does n't speak — and if you ask him : “ Why do n't you say something ? ” his blood seems to boil . If you ask him to take a cab , he suspects that you want to avoid meeting somebody — every word that you utter tortures him . And if —

lg.l: And if it were so , we are not alone , you are here .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , icy and cynical Just so , I am here — one word from me would save the situation — but — I know myself — I 'm a strange , whimsical , almost cruel man — and I 'm afraid I wo n't say the word . Tableau ! Embarrassing silence ! Then I say : “ I regret that I should have come at such an inopportune moment . ” I take my hat and walk out discreetly . If necessary , I can even stammer my excuses .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: If this is a jest , it 's a cruel one .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , bowing low Possible , Madame — but I can do better still . Of course , if you prefer it , I can make conversation — when your husband comes in , I can tell him that the portrait has not been touched and ask his pardon —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Pardon ? Pardon for what ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , bowing For having — quite accidentally — seen your shoulders .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , horrified Who are you ?

lg.l: I am one who always comes at the right moment — I come from

div.stage: Touching OLGA 'S forehead .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: What do you want with me ? You turn everything to evil . I have scarcely known you five minutes , and I seem to feel your fingers at my throat .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: That 's because I like you . With most pretty women I take longer .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , furiously , starts towards him Look here : this has gone far enough !

div.stage: Makes a few steps towards the DEVIL , who stands erect without moving . At the same time , HEINRICH comes to the door , which he opens , and starts speaking at once .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: The tailor has sent an evening suit , but it is not yours , sir .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Put it on the chair in the bedroom .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: But it 's not mine .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , gives a sign to HEINRICH to go out and do as he was told . Speaking to KARL It 's mine .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Yours ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , makes motion to HEINRICH , who goes outDuring speech OLGA goes up and gets her hat . KARL walks back and forth L. C .I had to have it pressed . I told the tailor to send it here . I must dress for tonight . I 'm going to a ball the prettiest woman in Vienna is giving at the house of the Duke of Maranse .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , coming down R ., frightened But the Duke does not live there now — he 's Ambassador in Madrid ; he has sold his house — to us .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I know . I met him in Paris . He told me —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: We are living there now — we are giving the ball .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Am I mistaken ? Am I not invited ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , in a very low voice , dropping her head Yes — yes , you are .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , very polite Madame , you asked me a little while ago what I wanted . That 's what I wanted . Thank you .

div.stage: Bows and turns towards C. Silence .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: But my husband —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , turning to her Will be delighted . I 've just come from Odessa . I have good news . Wheat is rising — this year 's crop turned out worse than they thought it would .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , greatly pleased Yes ? The crop is bad ?

div.stage: The DEVIL goes to big chair and kneels on it L .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: So you do love your husband ? You 're glad the crop is a failure ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Of course I am .As if she was somewhat ashamed about her husband 's speculations .We want the wheat to be bad because that will drive the price up .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What of that ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: My husband will make lots of money .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to OLGA And you will get that new gown .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: How do you know I want a new dress ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You have a new hat — a very pretty one — and you will certainly want a new dress to wear with it .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: You must be married .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Married ? Not the least — but I have an eye for feminine vanities . Oh , no ! A wife is like a single eyeglass — it looks very nice , but one is better off without it .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , R . You seem to have strong views against marriage . May I ask why ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , shaking his finger Because you are plotting matrimony against Karl , and I want to save him .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , starts toward him ; stops C . I beg your pardon —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: An artist ought never to marry — his wife will swear on the wedding day to stand by his side all through life . The day after the wedding she will stand in his way .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Not the real wife .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: The real wife is always the other man 's wife .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: You 're a cynic .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Oh , no , not cynical , only careful . A tigress who has married — I mean eaten — a man , is no longer dangerous — you can ride on her back through the jungle . But , you must wait till she has married — I mean eaten — somebody ; then she is quite safe .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Better to keep away from the tigress — and stay at home .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Then why did n't you stay at home P Why did you refuse a legitimate position — good , everyday morals — a decent occupation at so much a week ? You wanted to go into the jungle — and there you are . Now fight your battle — hunt tigers — but do n't get married !He now changes his tone , goes into the church chair , on whose back he leans his two arms , speaking as if from a pulpit . It is almost dark , and during this scene it becomes darker yet .And yet — what a splendid couple you two would make .OLGA , standing quite near the DEVIL but not looking at him , buries her face in her hands .Wake up !To KARL :You , with your talent , your splendid youth !To OLGA :You , with your temperament , and beauty and longing !

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: crosses to R . Stop ! Stop ! I beg you —OLGA backs to R. of back of chair , as though to protect DEVIL .— for years we have been just good friends .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: He now begins to speak in almost a whisper , but getting warmer and warmer , the more embarrassed KARL and OLGA become .You may say what you like , but I can read your eyes ; they say to me : “ Do n't believe him , he lies . ”

div.stage: Goes to fire and warms his hands , KARL stands below OLGA .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Do n't interrupt me . For six years we have been — good friends , nothing else . Olga cares nothing for me — and I — and I —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , quickly What will you give me to interrupt you now ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I do n't know what you , who profess to know everything , know about us , but anyone who thinks Karl capable of one base thought must be very low and contemptible himself .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Goes behind OLGA and whispers into her ear . At the end of the speech he is a little to the L. of them by the big chair .It 's not a base thought : it 's a great thought — a thought that brings joy and warmth and light into your wretched little lives . But joy has its price — and you must pay it , you misers ! The drunkard dies of drink , but while he is drunk angels in heaven sing to him . The poet dies in the ecstasy of his sweetest song . It is a coward 's bravery that turns away from the wine , the song — and the lips of woman . The smallest candle-end shows you it is worth while to burn up for the sake of a little warmth — a little light . The only end of life is to burn — to burn yourself up . You must flame and blaze like a torch and toss the fire about you . I know : your moralists tell you to love one another — do n't believe them — your grubby little earth with its paltry million years is not ripe for such a love as that . It can only breed monks , madmen , Methodists . Do n't be a fool , be a rogue — but be a jolly rogue — and the world is yours ! Look at me ! I own the earth . Here is the key of life — Love yourself — only yourself . Dress yourself in the softest garments — kiss the sweetest lips — drink of the wine of Life — Drink ! Drink ! Drink !

div.stage: Bell rings sharply — nobody moves .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , after a pause , in a low voice My husband —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Steps down from the chair , crossing C ., snaps his fingers angrily , and says afterwards , in a cold , cynical tone :Mr . Wheat .

div.stage: HEINRICH opens the door , and HERMAN comes in . HEINRICH follows him , but stops short at the door .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: I 'm afraid I 'm late . My agent has n't telephoned me yet , but I did n't want to make you wait too long . Rather dark in here !

div.stage: HEINRICH touches a button , lighting the lights , and exits .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , sees the DEVIL , presenting himself I 'm Herman Zanden , of Zanden Brothers & Wilde .

div.stage: DEVIL mutters something and shakes hands with him C .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , coming down R. KARL goes behind big chair Strange man .

lg.stage: Converses with KARL a few moments ; then to OLGA :
lg.l: Well , my dear , where 's the picture ? May n't I see it ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , in the big chair , leaning over back There 's nothing to see — there is no picture .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , looking at his watch What have you been doing ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Nothing .Silence .It 's been dark for the last hour .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Yes , but I 've been gone two hours .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , steps to the front L. C. very politely It was all my fault . We have been chatting . We 've had a very interesting discussion . And Madame was kind enough to invite me for this evening .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Oh ! I 'm very pleased .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , crosses to couch L. and sits Thank you . I have just come from Odessa . I had a talk with the Russian Wheat King . He tells me —

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Yes , I 've heard ; wheat 's going up .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , frightened Is n't that good for us ?

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: No , dear . I did not tell you this is the first year I am short on wheat .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What does it mean to be short on wheat ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , seated on couch L . It means digging a ditch for others and falling into it yourself .To HERMAN :I do n't think you 've any cause for uneasiness . I have inside information that the American crop will be excellent .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , C . If that is the case , I shall be safe .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You will be quite safe .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Do you also deal in wheat ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes and no . I dabble in everything . And always at improper moments .Rises .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , has been talking to OLGA , but now goes over to HERMAN I 'm afraid I can n't come before eleven o'clock this evening .

div.stage: Continues talking to HERMAN , and both go to fire .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , crosses and meets DEVIL , C . I must speak to you at once — alone .

div.stage: Looks around as if she wanted to say that her husband and KARL were in the way .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Alone ? Delighted !Crosses by her and goes up C. OLGA goes behind couch and DEVIL addresses HERMAN .By the way , if you want to see something delightfully bad , you ought to take a look at the sketch Karl made yesterday of your wife .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , coming down Where is the sketch ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: In the studio .

div.stage: HERMAN takes KARL 'S arm and walks to door of the studio ; in going into the studio speaks to KARL .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: I 'm sorry you did n't start Olga 's portrait today . What were you talking about all the time ?

div.stage: Goes into studio .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to OLGA I 'll wait for you here .

div.stage: He steps back into the room just in time to see MIMI enter from the hall .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , comes right in , crossing to C. Excuse me —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You want to see the painter ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , excited Yes , please .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , very gently , pushing MIMI out of the door into the hall and speaking through the door One minute , my dear . There are some visitors here . Sit down there . I 'll call you .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , comes quickly from the studio I wanted to tell you — to tell you —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: What is not true ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Whatever you are going to tell me .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: But believe me .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Surely no woman can expect that .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: But I am telling you the truth .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Ah ! I might believe you if you said you were not speaking the truth .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Must I think and speak only as you wish me to ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Not yet . Now what can I do for you ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , very earnestly L. C . Do n't come tonight . Now my husband has come , I am myself again , and your manner grates upon me . I had begun to feel as if some strange force — some invisible hand — was clutching me — holding me in spite of myself . There is a mystery about you . It frightens me . I thanked God when I heard that bell ring . He came just in time .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: To point a moral and break up a charming party . We were just beginning to understand each other .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Oh please stop !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Are you afraid ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: No , but I ask you not to come to our house this evening .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , with a very polite bow , then drawing himself up I shall come .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: And if my husband asks you not to come ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Your husband has already asked me to come .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: And if , in the presence of my husband , I ask you not to come ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Well , I 'll make a compromise with you . If you repeat your invitation in your husband 's presence , I shall accept ; if you do not , I will not come .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , breathing freely That 's nice of you — the first really nice thing you 've said . I like you much better .

div.stage: KARL and HERMAN come back from the studio , and HERMAN starts to talk at once to the DEVIL , KARL goes toward OLGA , who meets KARL up C .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , to HERMAN Shall we go ?

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Yes , dear ; put your coat on .

div.stage: Comes down L. DEVIL crosses to HERMAN .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , meets OLGA , they go up to recess . He helps OLGA to put her coat on . I see now how bad the sketch is .

div.stage: Holds mirror for OLGA while she puts her hat on .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Please do n't look at me like that .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Even if I do n't look at you , I see you just the same , Olga .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , covering her face with her hand We must give up the portrait , Karl ... I 'm going away ... away somewhere .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , L ., with HERMAN . You do n't say ? You represent Holman & Co. in London ? When I am in Odessa I am always old Mr. Holman 's guest . A charming old gentleman . No doubt you have heard the rumors . It seems they 've been mixed up with some unfortunate ventures which have seriously affected their standing .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , seated on couch Strange ! Another friend of mine spoke to me about it only yesterday .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes , but that is n't all . He 's the president of some trust company , and in order to boom the stocks he — but it 's a long story , I wo n't bore you with it now .

div.stage: Makes as if he wanted to go .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: My dear sir , this concerns me more than I can tell you . The fact is — I — I am heavily interested .

div.stage: OLGA has her hat on and turns , listening to HERMAN and the DEVIL .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You do n't say . But it 's a long story .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Well , then — tonight .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Oh , I am so sorry . I have excused myself already to Madame , but I had forgotten all about a call I must pay at the Russian Embassy this evening .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Well , lunch with me tomorrow ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , with a gesture of regret I 'm afraid it will be impossible . I leave tomorrow at nine o'clock for — Spain .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , to himself H 'm ! I must have this information .HERMAN crosses to C ., speaking to his wifeMy dear , wo n't you please ask the Doctor to try and arrange to come to our house this evening ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , somewhat embarrassed Well , but if pressing business ....

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , L. C . It is not so very pressing . Of course , it would mean a little sacrifice .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , R. C . Much as I would like to see you , Doctor , I cannot ask you to sacrifice anything for our sake .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , as if suddenly remembering something Come to think of it , the Russian Ambassador left town yesterday , so if Madame —

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , goes up C. DEVIL crosses to her R. C . Well , my dear ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , in a tone of resignation I hope we shall have the pleasure this evening —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , crosses to OLGA Pardon me . You said —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , very slowly I hope we shall have the pleasure of your company this evening ?

div.stage: Goes to door R .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , ironically Madame , I thank you for your invitation ; I shall be most charmed .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , coming down to KARL And you do n't come before eleven ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , by big chair No ; I expect an art dealer .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , suggestively I know your art dealers . Fie ! And you going to be married .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , curiously , and a bit jealous What is it ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Oh , nothing .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , up C. as if listening I think somebody knocked at the door .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: I did n't hear anything .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes , there it goes again .Cynically .Probably the art dealer .Goes to hall door , which he opens , steps out , speaking into the hall .Swings MIMI into room past OLGA , landing her C .Oh , it 's you , my dear . Come in . /#

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , as she comes in embarrassed Good evening .

div.stage: HEINRICH enters from studio .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , up C. embarrassed Good evening .

div.stage: MIMI goes up L .

lg.l: , R. C ., in a low tone to HERMAN
lg.stage: MIMI and OLGA stare at one another .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , laughing , going to door Well , au revoir .

div.stage: Exit .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to OLGA Quite a little comedy .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , at door R . You think so ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , to MIMI , pointing to the studio Please step in there , Fraeulein ; I 'll be with you in a minute .

div.stage: KARL turns to OLGA with hand out-stretched , as if to say good-bye . OLGA pretends not to see it and bows coldly .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , whispers to OLGA You were good enough to invite me for this evening : I am now going to repay your kindness . In five minutes I shall be back here to interrupt this tete-a-tete . Watch me forget my overcoat .

div.stage: He takes the overcoat which KARL had put on a chair at the beginning of the act when he came in . HEINRICH helps the DEVIL to put on the overcoat , but notices that it is his master 's .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Pardon , sir ; but this is not your overcoat . This —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , aside to HEINRICH Shut up !

div.stage: DEVIL goes off ; HEINRICH follows him out .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , comes C. to MIMI Did n't I promise you I 'd come ? What do you want ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , coming to him Were you ashamed to have those people see me ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I told you , I 'd come . What more do you want ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I was downstairs in the lunch room and thought it all over . Dear Karl , do n't be mean — do n't get married .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: But — Mimi !

lg.l: I never used to care , but now that I 've seen those people
I — I can n't bear it . Do n't get married !

div.stage: Cries .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You must n't cry — it spoils your beauty .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Oh , I 'm a fool .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Now , you 're talking sense .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I 've been a silly girl — but it 's all over now . I 'm sensible again . You are going to settle down and marry Elsa and be the most famous portrait painter in all Europe .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Mimi , child — do n't speak of portraits . I feel at this moment as if I never wanted to hear the word portrait again . I 'd like to run away from everything , Mimi . What do you say ?Illustration : Mimi and KarlGoes to couch L. and sits .Suppose you and I get married and go away — far away into the country — or to the United States , where we 'd never be heard of again .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , kneels beside him Do you mean that ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , recklessly Yes — yes !

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , gives him her hand That 's mighty nice of you , Karl .Rises , goes L. C .But no ! even if you really mean it — which you do n't —

div.stage: Makes an effort to control herself .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , interrupting Mimi !

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: No , Karl ; I 'd only keep you back — you must marry in your own set .Changes tone .But do n't run away — with — with anybody . Good-bye .—— -

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No , do n't go ! Now you have come , you might as well stay a while — take your hat off .Helps her off with her hat and jacket .I 'm glad you came back . Now , let 's be sensible — and talk it over . You know I really am fond of you — after all , I am your best friend and you are my — my —

div.stage: The DEVIL has silently opened the door and comes in .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: My — my overcoat must be somewhere . Your stupid servant gave me yours .Takes coat off .It 's funny , but every time I come here , you are helping some lady to take off her things .

div.stage: MIMI goes to couch .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , horrified Well , I never .

div.stage: Exit .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You have every qualification for a ladies ’ tailor .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You are very kind .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Do n't mention it .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , impolitely I 'll fetch your overcoat ; I do n't want to detain you .

div.stage: Puts out lights and goes towards studio .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: The hanger was torn off . I asked your man to mend it and bring it here when it was done .Sits up C. Silence .I just saw something very touching .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What ?

div.stage: Goes to C. and sits on arm of chair by DEVIL .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: The way that woman clung to her husband 's arm as if for protection .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: For protection ?Sneeringly .From you ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Look here , my boy ; do you think you are wise to be such a fool ?

div.stage: KARL rises , starts away , DEVIL catches him by hand .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I do n't want to talk about it . You do n't seem to understand my position . I have seen this woman for years every day , and I never even thought — and if I had thought — I should have laughed at myself .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , rises , takes both KARL 'S hands Look at her ! She 's yours . Think what it means — joy , unspeakable joy — the most supreme joy one can have . And to think that you are too lazy to stretch out your hand ! Why , another one would toil day and night , would risk life and limb for such a prize — and it just drops at your feet — a windfall .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: I suppose that 's why —In a tone as if he did n't think much of it .— just a windfall .

div.stage: Sits on couch .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , sits on table L. C . Last fall , on the sixth of September — I shall never forget the date — something strange happened to me . I put on an old suit I had n't worn for a long time , and as I picked up the waistcoat , a sovereign fell out . God knows how long it had been there . As I turned this sovereign over to look at it , it suddenly slipped through my fingers and rolled away . I looked and looked , but my sovereign was gone . I become nervous : I can n't find the sovereign . I search around for half an hour , three quarters of an hour , still I can n't find it . I get angry , I get furious . I shift the furniture — no sovereign . I call my man — we both look everywhere until it 's dark . I 'm perspiring and trembling — I have but one idea : I must get that sovereign back . Suddenly a suspicion comes into my mind — I get up from my knees . I scream at the top of my voice to my servant : “ You thief , you have found the sovereign and put it into your pocket . ” The man gets angry and answers me disrespectfully . I am about to strike him when I see the blade of a knife shining in his hands . I draw my revolver —Takes a shining revolver out of his pocket and rises .— and with this revolver I nearly killed a man for a sovereign —Look from KARL .— I did n't need and had never missed — just a found sovereign .

div.stage: Puts revolver on table .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , embarrassed I give found money away .

div.stage: Turns on couch from him .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I would have given it away , but — it slipped through my fingers , and whatever slips through our fingers , that is just the one thing we want .Goes to KARL .We break our necks for it : that 's human nature . And if it once slips through your fingers , you will run after your found sovereign . And then , when it is too late , you will discover it was worth having .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: To draw a revolver for a found sovereign ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , sitting by him And that little woman will become dearer and more precious to you every day — you will realize that she could have given you wings — that her temperament , her beauty , her passion , would have been the inspiration of your work — all this you 'll realize when she has slipped away . You could have become a master — a giant ! Not by loving your art , but by loving her — but you wo n't know it till it is too late — too late .He now takes the shawl with which OLGA had draped her shoulders .This shawl has touched her bosom —Throws one end over KARL 'S shoulder , forcing him to see it . KARL clasps the shawl and touches his lips to it .Think what you might have been to one another ! What divine happiness , not because she is beautiful — no , but because you —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , throws shawl L. of couch Be quiet ! Be quiet ! Do you want to drive me mad ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , rises and goes to head of couch A life that has not been squandered — has not been lived —

lg.l: Why do you tell me all this ? Why ? What do you want ?
lg.stage: Throws himself face down on couch .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , darkly Nobody ! No one ! I am here .

div.stage: Touches KARL 'S forehead .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No ! And a thousand times no .Throws himself face down again on couch . Screams very loud .No ! Do you hear me ? No ! I have known her all these years , and we 've been good friends only — and we 'll remain good friends , nothing else . I do n't want the found sovereign !

div.stage: Moving to end of couch .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , coming down L. of couch ; very emphatically And if it slips away ?Silence . Then quickly :If another man runs away with it —?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , suddenly jumping at a conclusion Who ?

div.stage: Looks at the DEVIL .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , triumphant I .Silence .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You ?

div.stage: Laughs and turns from him .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Tonight ! This very night she 'll be mine !Laughs .Oh , what joy ! What exquisite joy . For ten thousand years I have had no prettier mistress !

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , turning to him What do you say ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , sitting L. head of couch Mistress , I said . Come tonight — to her house — when the lights are burning — when the air seems to be filled with music and perfume . You 'll see — before day dawns .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Enough ! Enough !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: How you will run after your lost sovereign ! Every hour when you wonder where she is , she spends with me . A carriage passes : your heart stands still . Who 's in that carriage ? Shall I tell you ? We ! You see a couple vanish around a corner , clinging lovingly to one another . Who were they ? We ! Always we . A light goes out in some window . Who put that light out ? We ! We sit in every carriage , we vanish around every corner — clinging lovingly together ; we stand behind every window curtain in close embrace , looking into your tortured face , your maddened eyes — and we cling closer — closer — and we laugh — - we laugh !

div.stage: Laughs long .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Throws himself face down , back to audience , on couch , in terrible state of excitement , screaming at top of his voice :You fiend !

div.stage: Reaches for revolver with R. hand . DEVIL grabs his hand and holds revolver . KARL draws away and sits staring straight ahead , DEVIL rises , leaves revolver on table , lights cigarette , then comes below table .
HEINRICH enters the room noiselessly , carrying a lighted candle , goes behind the DEVIL and helps him to put his fur coat on .
DEVIL puts his silk hat on , gives a tip to HEINRICH , takes up the revolver , puts it into his pocket , and says to KARL with a sad smile , in a warm tone like a father speaking to his son :

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You see , my boy , one may draw a revolver for a lost sovereign .

div.stage: Goes to the door . As he opens the door , a look of devilish satisfaction comes into his eyes .

div.head: ACT II

stage.stage: SCENE .— A conservatory in Zanden 's house . The L. side of the stage as well as the whole back of the stage is taken up by large bay windows , through which one sees into the garden . In the distance the wall surrounding the house , and some trees in the garden . It is winter . Bright weather , but it has been snowing . In the garden as well as in the street , electric lamps . On the R. side of the stage there are two doors , one quite near to the footlights , leading into the apartment — one in the rear , leading to the hall . There is a platform about two yards long and two yards wide , between these two doors . Five steps lead from this platform towards the footlights , and five steps on the side of the platform to the middle of the stage . On the top of the platform a door leading to the ball-room . When this door is opened , one generally hears the ball music . At the foot of the stairs , about three yards from the footlights , two square columns having a brass ornament with eight electric lamps attached . There are heaps of plants and flowers about the room . Two chairs and a table stand on the R. side of the stage , about three yards from the footlights , two chairs and a table on the L. side of the stage , about five yards from the footlights . There are two settees , L. and R. On the table L. writing material . It is about one o'clock at night .

div.stage: Guests in fancy costumes are moving about as the Curtain goes up .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: , sitting L. of table R . Who is the dark man you left so suddenly in the ball room ?

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: , enters and comes down stairs to back of table L . I do n't know his name .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: A most disagreeable man .

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: , crosses to group L. C . Oh , dreadful ! He behaved shockingly to my husband . He told him that it will be so cold tonight that his teeth will shiver in their box .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: Olga tells me he is a friend of Herr Karl 's , and she only invited him as a compliment to him .

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: stoutHe insisted on telling me of a remedy for obesity . I do n't consider myself stout — do you ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , C ., laughingly No ! I think I 'm just right . He sounds interesting — I 'd like to meet him .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: You 'll be sorry if you do .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Oh , indeed .

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: He 'll be very disagreeable , I assure you .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I 'm not afraid of him .

div.stage: Wants to go up steps .

lg.l: Miss Elsa , I really think you had better not .

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: If Miss Elsa wants to speak to him let her do so . I think she is the only one really capable of putting him in his place .

sp.speaker: THIRD LADY GUEST
sp.p: , seated L. of table R . Oh , she 'll make him sit up .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Thanks , awfully . Oh , I know what you call me — the blue-stocking — sassy Elsa —

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: Elsa , I never said you were a blue-stocking .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: I never called you Sassy Elsa .

lg.l: But I am — you know I am —
That 's why nobody dares to tell me how to get thin .

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: The impertinence !

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Well — you asked for it .

sp.speaker: SECOND LADY GUEST
sp.p: , to FIRST LADY GUEST It will serve her right if —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , on the stairs I 'd just like to see him —

div.stage: The DEVIL is standing in front of her . Everybody is silent .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , in evening dress , red carnation in buttonhole ; after some silence I never dreamed how quiet it could be when seven ladies are not talking .Protesting movement on the part of the GUESTS .Oh , I know — you have been very merciful to me in my absence .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , on stairs You need n't think I am afraid to say what I think to your face . I was just about to —

div.stage: She makes a movement showing that she wanted to look for him .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You did well to stay . They would have said much worse things about you — they would have spoken about your approaching engagement to Karl .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: What !Astonished .You know ?

lg.l: To my friend Karl — they want to throw you into his arms .
lg.stage: In a low voice to ELSA :
lg.l: I 'd like to speak to you — alone .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Here ?

div.stage: Gesture that she thinks this impossible in a crowded room .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: We 'll be alone in no time .

div.stage: ELSA goes to sofa and sits L. of table L .

sp.speaker: FOURTH LADY GUEST
sp.p: , crosses to him ; to DEVIL I 'm very glad you spoke that way to Elsa . You have quite won me over , and I do n't mind telling you I came very near having to pick a bone with you .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , R. C ., to FOURTH LADY GUEST , who is very thin — looking at her from head to foot By the way , speaking of bones —

sp.speaker: FOURTH LADY GUEST
sp.p: What ! Again !— oh !

div.stage: Walks off highly offended .

sp.speaker: FIRST GENTLEMAN GUEST
sp.p: , very effeminate , smiling to the DEVIL Bravo ! I could n't do that — not that I lack courage . I am famous for my courage — I just love a fight — I once slapped the face of an athlete who dared to insult a lady .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You coward !

sp.speaker: FIRST GENTLEMAN GUEST
sp.p: What — coward ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes , coward . If you dared to slap the face of a cripple I might admire your courage .

div.stage: FIRST GENTLEMAN GUEST starts to answer , but afterwards makes a gesture seeming to say nothing can be done with the DEVIL — going off slowly up the stairs .

sp.speaker: SECOND GENTLEMAN GUEST
sp.p: , after a few seconds talking quietly to the DEVIL Oh-h-h ! You are a free-thinker . So am I !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , as if astonished You think ?

sp.speaker: SECOND GENTLEMAN GUEST
sp.p: I do .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: What with ?Exit SECOND GENTLEMAN GUEST , angrily .To SECOND LADY GUEST , the stout one , seated R. of table L .A pity you do n't dance — there 's nothing like it for reducing the figure .

div.stage: SECOND LADY GUEST rushes of .

lg.l: , L. to the THIRD LADY GUEST , pointing at FOURTH
Her husband must be in the furniture business .

sp.speaker: THIRD LADY GUEST
sp.p: Yes , who told you ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Her dress — it is the very latest pattern for arm-chairs and settees — but please do n't say I said so .

sp.speaker: THIRD LADY GUEST
sp.p: , smiling Certainly not .Goes to chair of FIRST LADY GUEST .Jane —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , joins ELSA . To ELSA Look — she 's telling her .

sp.speaker: THIRD LADY GUEST
sp.p: , to FIRST LADY GUEST But promise me not to be angry .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: She promises .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: I promise .

sp.speaker: THIRD LADY GUEST
sp.p: He said that —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Look out for the explosion .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: , rises Oh , I never —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Now — watch her go .

sp.speaker: FIRST LADY GUEST
sp.p: I never !

div.stage: Goes off over the staircase .

sp.speaker: THIRD LADY GUEST
sp.p: , going after her But , Jane , you promised me —

div.stage: Exit .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Voila ! I am now at your disposal .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , on settee L . Are n't you surprised I have n't gone ? You insulted me , too . I only stay because I want to speak to you .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Oh , do n't try to be polite — just be yourself . I 'm not afraid of you .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I know it .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , crosses up to C . Perhaps you know my nickname — Saucy Elsa ?

div.stage: DEVIL nods his head .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Politeness would only embarrass me — and I have chosen you to deliver a message to that crowd — only because you can be so delightfully rude .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I am at your entire disposal .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Now , how can I be saucy when you talk like that ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I am your devoted servant .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You 're impossible .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Shall we end this conference ?

div.stage: DEVIL starts up C .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , goes to table R. C. and leans against it Not yet , please . You informed me just now that I am the girl they want to throw into the arms of your friend Karl .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You forget to say I am the girl who allows herself to be thrown in your friend 's arms . Is that right ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , stands and pushes forward chair Please sit down .

div.stage: DEVIL bows , but remains standing .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , in a very loud voice . Crosses and sits Please sit down . I do n't ask you out of politeness , but because I want to set you right in this matter — and it is much easier for me to set you right when you sit down and I stand up . I do n't want people to make fun of me — I know what they say — do you understand me ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , gets up I do .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Sit down , please .He does so .I do n't want people to smile and congratulate me to my face , and laugh behind my back . I wo n't have it — and as you started this subject I shall entrust you with the mission of enlightening our friends out there .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Your confidence honors me .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Do n't think for a moment that I have taken these people seriously — I have no more interest in them than I have for yesterday 's newspaper . But I do n't choose to have them think that they have fooled me into marrying Karl . And —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , starts to rise . She stops him Pardon me .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I see through their scheme . But I shall marry him just the same , if he will have me . Do you understand me ? I shall marry him —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Pardon me . I do n't think you will .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You will see .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You have been kind enough to honor me with your confidence , and now I will be quite frank with you . This marriage cannot come off .

div.stage: Stands up .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , points to chair Please sit down .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , takes her hands and swings her into chair No ! You will sit down now because I am going to set you right . I know the reason of this marriage — but you —A MAN SERVANT crosses stage ; DEVIL calls him .You will find in my overcoat a small leather satchel — bring it here .MAN SERVANT goes off .Continuing to ELSA :But you do n't know the reason — or you do n't want to know it . And you are about to consent to —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , interrupting To what ? To marry a man who is not madly in love with me — any more than I am with him . What of it ? We are two perfectly sane people about to make a serious contract with our eyes wide open , instead of blinded by infatuation like crazy lovers in magazine stories . What other contract made by crazy people would be valid for one minute — and this is for a life-time —

div.stage: Enter SERVANT and hands bag to DEVIL and exits .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , smiling True — for a lifetime .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You are a man of the world ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , gravely Of many worlds .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Looks up quickly as if about to ask the DEVIL what he means , but checks herself and continues :Well , in this world — is it the man chooses the woman , or the woman who chooses the man ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , smiling We are the weaker sex .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Answer me ! Which chooses ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: The man sometimes chooses the engagement ring —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , holding up her head proudly , and looking her very prettiest , straight into his eyes Look at me , please .

div.stage: The DEVIL looks into her eyes .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , proudly Now tell me , can I or can I not choose the man I will marry ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , leaning on table R ., in a courtly manner It is written in your eyes — but — I never thought this subject would excite you so .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , seated L. of him , with animation I wo n't be laughed at — I do n't care what those people thinkbecoming excitedI know what I am doing , and in spite of everything I choose to become his wife .

Head high , my little girl — - that 's it — and if anybody dares to call you saucy again , tell him that you once met a gentleman at a ball to whom you thought to give a piece of your mind , that would make him feel very , very small — and instead you left with a piece of his mind , that made you feel very , very small — and made him feel — as if he were the greatest Scoundrel in the world —Taking a few steps to the footlights .which perhaps he is .
