sp.p: What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: The way he seemed to look through me . It was almost as if he imagined — what did you say ? What did you insinuate ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Just what you are thinking .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , her hands dropping , her head falling backwards with closed eyes , shivering Oh ! How could you ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , cynically Come now , do n't pretend to be shocked . You admitted you felt it the moment you came in . The thought seemed to please you .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: How dare you speak to me like that ! Oh ! if I had known .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Then why did n't you take off your cloak ? When you saw — you did n't even open it . Why do n't you open it now ? The idea seems to please you still .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , re-enters , angrily . Olga !

div.stage: DEVIL gives her his arm . As they are about to go upstairs , KARL comes back from R .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , looking coldly over shoulder at KARL Are you going to stay here ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Yes ; and you , too !

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: You stay here .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: What 's that ?

div.stage: OLGA tries to go away with the devil into the ball-room , but KARL steps into their way on the stairs .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Olga , you shall not go into the ball-room !DEVIL , as if about to leave them alone , is held off by KARL , who steps in front of him now .You shall not leave — it concerns you , too .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Doctor , give me your arm . Doctor !

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , in tone of command Stop ! We 'll settle this thing now — right here !

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Are you mad ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , goes up stairs below KARL If I did n't think he was mad —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Take off that cloak .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , at L. foot of stairs firmly ; No

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Take , off that cloak .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , to DEVIL Please , Doctor , protect me .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , half maddened Then I 'll make you !

div.stage: KARL rushes down stairs , DEVIL catches him before he reaches the bottom and holds him back .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , standing very erect , to DEVIL Why did you stop him —?

div.stage: DEVIL lets KARL go .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , at foot of stairs , in a very low voice as if ashamed Really , Madame , for all I know —

div.stage: Feigns embarrassment .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , to DEVIL Will you please help me off with my cloak ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , starts to help , then crosses to L. of her , with gesture of refusal . Madame ! Ah !

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , comes down to her , C . I will .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , very loud No .

div.stage: Wraps herself closer in the cloak .
DEVIL and KARL stare at each other . The DEVIL shrugs his shoulders , OLGA goes up the stairs .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , coming through the door Oh ! There you are . My dear ! His Excellency is looking for you . He is about to leave .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , as if very tired All right . Please help me off with my cloak .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: All right , darling .

div.stage: Takes off her cloak and puts it over his arm . [ OLGA stands in the same gown as she had on at the beginning of the act , with her back to the audience .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , looking at KARL and DEVIL , and speaking with ironical courtliness , taking HERMAN 'S arm . Gentlemen .

div.stage: Exit HERMAN with OLGA .
KARL has been standing on one side of the stage as if dreaming , suddenly runs to the other side of the stage as if to choke the devil who stands there .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , crossing to DEVIL , L. C . What have you done ?

div.stage: DEVIL thrusts revolver into KARL 'S hand .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Look out ! It 's loaded !KARL stands absolutely still , holding revolver . [ To KARL , insolently :If I had n't given you that pistol you might have slapped my face . Believe me , there 's nothing like turning the other cheek — if you turn it quickly enough — your enemy will miss both cheeks .

div.stage: KARL turns away angrily , lays revolver on table R .
DEVIL goes down and takes revolver from table R .
KARL stands absent-minded , when ELSA enters with her cloak ready to leave .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Karl , I wanted to say good-bye to you .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , as if the tone of her voice was awakening him Oh ! my dear , dear Elsa !

div.stage: About to go towards her to kiss her .
The DEVIL comes back and steps between them .
MAN SERVANT enters from behind stairs and speaks to ELSA .

sp.speaker: MAN SERVANT
sp.p: Your mother is waiting for you in the hall , Fraeulein ,

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: May I see you to your carriage ?

div.stage: Offers ELSA his arm and they go off .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to MAN SERVANT Will you accompany Miss Elsa to her carriage ? It is slippery outside , she might fall .

div.stage: Exit MAN SERVANT , following KARL and ELSA .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , enters from R ., agitated ; sits at table L . Your scheme was a great success .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: What are you going to do ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , writes on an envelope I 'm going to write to him .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , crosses to her , reads the envelope To Karl — but what will you write ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: He wanted to settle my account . I will settle his . I will never see him again . Oh ! To have thought me capable — of .... How could he ? I despise him !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Pour quoi , Madame ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Because — because —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Because you love him ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , frightened What !Tries to get her thoughts together .After what has happened , I hate him . And I shall tell him so .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I am very sorry .

div.stage: Takes pen from her .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Do n't be sorry . I have much to thank you for . You have rendered me a service . I shall feel better when I have sent this letter off .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You 'd better make it plain .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I shall speak my mind — there shall be no mistake .

lg.l: That 's it ; express your real feelings .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Cold ? Harsh ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Make an end of it — once for all .

div.stage: Dipping pen .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , taking pen Once for all .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Now write .

div.stage: OLGA speaks the first sentence as she writes it . At the word “ longer ” the devil takes it up , finishing the sentence with a different meaning , and dictates rest of letter walking up and down .
Illustration : Dr. Miller ( The Devil

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , in hard voice , speaks while writing Sir , your behavior of this evening has shown me that you are no longer —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , continuing — able to keep up the wretched farce of mere friendship . I read your inmost thought tonight and — Karl — the knowledge that you love me has made me unspeakably happy . Dearest —OLGA looks up at the DEVIL , who is standing now at her L. He repeats “ Dearest ” and points to letter . She resumes writing .— why should we struggle any longer against the resistless tide that is drawing us together ? My strength is gone .OLGA looks up again . The DEVIL repeats “ My strength is gone ” by motion of lips , making no sound . She writes :— without you I am lost in the black waters — save me , Karl . With your strong arms about me — with your lips to mine — I care not where we drift . I am yours , all yours . You are the master of my soul . Do not leave me , Karl ; I love you , I cannot live without you . God bless you !

div.stage: OLGA 'S head falls forward on her arm

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , as if awakening What have I written ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , folding letter What was in your heart !

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , laughs hysterically I have written everything I had meant never to say .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , taking up letter If women wrote time tables , they would tell all the hours that the trains did n't start and all the places you must n't stop at to get to your destination .

div.stage: DEVIL puts the letter into envelope .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , horrified What are you doing ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , coldly I will deliver the letter . Women sometimes do not write what they want , but they always want what they write .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: He must not . He shall not see it .

div.stage: HERMAN comes down stairs

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Good ! You 're the kind of guest I like — when all the rest have deserted the ship you stay and keep the hostess company .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , crosses to C ., putting letter into his pocket Madame has been so entertaining , that I —

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , crossing to bell R . Well , let 's have another cognac before you go — quite en famille .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Thank you very much , but I have an important call very early in the morning . Madame ,—Goes to OLGA , kisses her hand .To HERMAN :I have spent a very pleasant evening at your house .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , coming to him C ., they shake hands The pleasure is mine .

div.stage: DEVIL starts to go . OLGA utters a suppressed cry .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Madame ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , frightened to death , with a forced smile trying to appear undisturbed There was a piece of paper here . Did you perhaps take it by mistake ?

div.stage: She is almost crying from fright .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , coming down stairs , taking the letter out of his pocketGoing towards HERMAN as if he was going to give him the letter .Do you mean this ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , deathly pale No , no It was not that .

div.stage: Laughing bitterly .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , bowing Madame .

div.stage: Bows to HERMAN . Goes off upstairs . Bows low to both and goes out .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: crosses to OLGA Well , I 'm glad it 's over . You look tired , dearie .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , standing by table L . I am tired .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: You look flushed . But it 's very becoming , you never looked prettier .OLGA is leaning backwards over the table , he takes her hand .My darling wife .

div.stage: Goes to kiss her .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , unkind Please , please do n't .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: , crosses to C. Looks at his watch It is after four o'clock , Olga .

div.stage: Tries to kiss her again .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Please , please do n't . I feel so nervous .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: Your cheeks are burning .

div.stage: Pats her cheeks .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , nervous , impatient Please —

lg.l: All right , all right , I 'm going .
lg.stage: He goes towards the door on the R .
lg.l: Are you going to stay here ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , at table L . Let me rest a minute .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: As you please .

div.stage: MAN SERVANT comes in above platform , and goes up side stairs .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , to servant What do you want ?

sp.speaker: MAN SERVANT
sp.p: The lights , Madame .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Turn off the lights .

div.stage: The MAN SERVANT puts all the lights out . The lamps in the street and the garden are lighted , but the room is dark .

sp.speaker: HERMAN
sp.p: It would be wiser to sleep , my dear .

div.stage: He waits a minute , shrugs his shoulders , then goes out R .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , stands leaning on the table To go to sleep ....The DEVIL can be seen outside in his fur overcoat , crossing through the garden . As he passes a lamp in the garden his shadow reaching up to the ceiling is thrown on the white wall of the room , OLGA is crossing to R. He takes his hat off , at which moment she sees the shadow on the wall , OLGA shrieks .No !

div.stage: She drops into a chair .
CURTAIN

div.head: ACT III

stage.stage: SCENE .— Like Act I . The afternoon of the next day , about three o'clock . When the curtain rises , the DEVIL is seated in a big chair . Bell rings off stage R. HEINRICH enters R .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , rising from chair What do you want ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: There is a lady , sir .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: What kind of a lady ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: A real lady , sir .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: What does she want ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: She wants to see my master . I told her he was not up yet , but she said she would wait .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Do you know who the lady is ? Have you seen her before ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Never .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Ask her to step in here .HEINRICH goes off , shows ELSA in .DEVIL bows .Ah !

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You seem to be everywhere . What are you doing here ? Are you his secretary ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: No , merely a good friend . Nothing else . I just happened in . By the way , how do you do ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: How do you do ?Crosses to couch , sits .I did n't know there was anybody in this room or I would not have come in . But as it is only you I do n't mind .

div.stage: ELSA sits down , intentionally turning her back to the DEVIL .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Karl is expecting you , then ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Oh , no .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Will you permit me to prepare him for this pleasant surprise ?

lg.l: No , thank you . Do n't disturb him . I can look around while
I 'm waiting . I have never been here before .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I know it .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Who told you ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: The man — a lady might come every day and escape notice — but coming for the first time she would be sure to attract his attention .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I feel embarrassed coming here alone .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I know that , too .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: From the same source ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes ; he said you were a real lady .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: He is the only one here who has spoken to me like a gentleman .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: He must have thought you were a model .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , rises ; angrily How dare you ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: A servant can only speak like a gentleman to — his equals .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , sits down again ; sarcastically Then I was mistaken — it is not Heinrich who is the servant .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Who knows — perhaps he is a clergyman .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I do n't understand you .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Only two people in the world may open the door of a bachelor 's apartment to a young lady — the man servant , or a clergyman with a marriage certificate — you can take your choice .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Let me tell you I was once left alone with a gentleman who tried to kiss me , and I slapped his face .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Indeed ? I was once left alone with a lady who tried to slap me and I kissed her face .

div.stage: Enter HEINRICH .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , controlling herself with difficulty Oh !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Heinrich ! There 's a little leather satchel in the pocket of my overcoat .

div.stage: HEINRICH goes out .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Do n't be afraid . This is not my day for crying .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: It 's when a girl laughs that I 'm most afraid .HEINRICH brings the satchel , puts it on the table L. C. and goes into studio .Why did you come here ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I intend to sit for my portrait — to do that , I must come every day .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You intend to come here every day , and to do that you must have your portrait painted .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You are clever at twisting words .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Perhaps you know there is another lady coming every day to have her portrait painted ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Yes , I know . That 's why I want mine painted — we 'll see which will be the better likeness .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Come now — you must let me sit down — this time I want you to be right .Raises her and swings her in front of him .DEVIL sits on couch , ELSA leans on table .Are you aware —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: This is awful — you question me like a judge .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: It is you who answer like a prisoner . Do you know that Karl is in love with Olga ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , bitterly Do I know it !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: And you still mean to fight ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Yes , I mean to fight — you gave me good advice .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: That was yesterday .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Well — this is to-day .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , impressively Yesterday was your winning day . Yesterday it was written that you , Elsa , would succeed in whatever thing you made up your mind to do , with the whole strength of your will .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Last night I made up my mind to —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , interrupting gravely — to dance every dance —PauseYou danced every dance .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , defiantly Karl asked me to marry him last night .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: — and you refused .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Yes — but to-day I shall —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: To-day is not your winning day — yesterday you chose — to-day you will have no choice .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I wo n't give him up — I can n't — I do n't know how .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You will have to learn — let me see — I think I know some one who has learned the lesson and can teach it to you —Goes to hall door which he opens .Why , Mimi ! Why do you wait out there ? Come in here where it 's warm !

div.stage: MIMI comes in — DEVIL seats MIMI C. He regards them both with a satanic smile — begins to hum a tune and exits L ., singing as he gets out ; he laughs — his laugh dies away outside .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , sitting on small chair C. After a silence Are you waiting for the painter , too , Madame ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , seated on couch Yes .

lg.l: He must have been on a spree last night .
When he goes on a spree he always sleeps late .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , somewhat embarrassed Yes ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , making conversation Yes . If you have n't slept for a long time , then — you must sleep a long time .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Yes ?

lg.l: Is Madame going to have her portrait painted ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Yes .

lg.l: Yes , Madame — I know all the ladies that come here —
I 'm quite at home here — I 'm his model
I do n't pay for my portraits .
You have a splendid profile , Madame .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You always say “ Madame ” — I am not married . My name is —

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , interrupting I know your name . I 've heard it often . You belong to a very rich family . I know what that means , I used to be well off , too . I was n't always obliged to work for a living .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: No ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I was a chorus girl , but I had bad luck .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I am so sorry for you .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Silence .I know all about you and Herr Karl .

div.stage: Rises , goes C .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: From whom ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I know everything that goes on in this house . I told you I was his model — I sew on buttons and count the laundry .

div.stage: Importantly .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Does the laundry-woman steal ?

lg.l: No . But she uses strong blueing — I know everything Herr

div.stage: Pointing at ELSA .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , as if she was getting interested And does that interest you ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Yes , indeed it does . But that 's all over now

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Why so ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Because he is going to get married

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: But he will paint just the same — he will want models .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Yes , but —Ingeniously .you know , when one has sewn on buttons — and counted the laundry — then to be — just a plain model — that hurts .

div.stage: Goes up C .; ELSA crosses .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: And you like Herr Karl ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , repressing her feelings Yes — I — I like him — he 's such a dear boy .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Does he paint you now ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , coming to head of couch ; sadly No . He only paints landscapes and — bank presidents .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Then you did not come to pose to-day ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: A model always comes to pose . It 's tiring work , too , I can tell you — and if the artist wants to make love — it is n't her fault — and —Sighs .Oh , it 's such a rest .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Oh , please .

div.stage: Draws herself up stiffly , offended .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Now I 've offended you — I ought to have known better — my people are all refined — I was n't born a model .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I 'm sorry I showed it — but — I — I 'm nervous to-day .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , brightening Oh , I know what it is — I used to suffer dreadfully from nervousness when I was in the chorus .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Come over here , Mimi ; I want to talk to you .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , goes over and sits on the couch You can talk to me about everything , I 'm not a bad sort , really I 'm not . I 've known all along about Herr Karl and — and you — he 's such a kind man . I was crying when I went away yesterday , and he felt sorry for me and he came to see me on his way to the ball — in his evening clothes — but I did n't receive him . If it 's over , it may as well be over .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Was he fond of you ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I loved him , but what 's the use ? It 's like the railway — the station is there and the train comes and then the train goes away , and the station cannot run after it ; if the station is small , the train only stops a minute , and —Sighs .one must wait until another train comes

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You loved him and can speak like that ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Yes , I loved him , but it 's all over now . I was foolish to come here again when I 'd made up my mind I would n't , but now I 'm sensible again ; I 'll go away and try to forget him , I hope he will be — hap-hap — happy !

div.stage: Begins to cry , looks for handkerchief in muff , but can n't find it . ELSA takes handkerchief out of “ weeping satchel , ” and gives it to her .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Poor Mimi ! Poor Mimi !

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , wiping her eyes with handkerchief , then returning it to ELSA . I — hope — you will be — hap — happy — too !

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: I — happy ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: You are going to marry Karl —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: No — no — I 'm not .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: But it 's you he 's in love with —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: No , Mimi ; I 'm not the one — it 's some one else .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: You do n't mean Mrs. Zanden — it can n't be — why , she 's your friend .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: She was .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: I do n't believe it — it 's not love — it 's a madness — a —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , jumping at the idea An infatuation ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Yes , that 's it — he 's not in love with her — he 's not himself .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: You think so ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Yesterday he acted as if he were under some strange —Rises .MIMI looks nervously behind her on both sides , ELSA follows her example .under some strange —

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Influence ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Yes .

div.stage: The two girls look at each other in silence — - for what seems like a minute .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Mimi , who is that man ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , looks behind her again nervously I do n't know — I hate him .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: , after looking behind her So do I .

div.stage: They grasp each other 's hands across the table .
A pause .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: , holding ELSA 'S hand I 'm glad I came , I feel better already for having seen you . I 'm going to be sensible now . I 'm going away — and I 'm never coming back !In altered voice .What time is it ?

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: It 's almost three o'clock .

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Three o'clock ! Then I must hurry . I have an appointment at half past — he 's an illustrator — such a talented boy ; he 's just had a picture accepted by the Fleigende Blatter .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: And you are posing for him ?

sp.speaker: MIMI
sp.p: Oh , yes ; but tonight he goes to the artists ’ dinner , and I have to find his dress studs , and iron a tie for him , and trim his cuffs .Makes gesture of cutting with scissors outside the edge of her cuff .Good-bye .

div.stage: Goes out quickly .

sp.speaker: ELSA
sp.p: Looks after MIMI , then around the room , suddenly begins to sob , and calls in frightened voice :Mimi ! Mimi !

div.stage: Runs off .
DEVIL enters just as ELSA leaves .
DEVIL rings bell on table .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: , entering Did you ring , sir ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Where is my tea ? Have you any rum in the house ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Yes , sir .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I 'll have some with my tea . Is your master getting up ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Yes , sir .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Has anyone called to see him this morning ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Mrs. Zanden 's maid has been here three times .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: What did she want ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: She inquired whether Mrs. Zanden could see my master . I told her I had strict orders not to call him before three .

div.stage: DEVIL goes into studio .
HEINRICH goes out to hall , door slams , OLGA speaking outside .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Is your master at home ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Yes , Madame .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , entering My maid told me I could not see him until three — it is three o'clock now .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: I am very sorry , Madame , but you will have to wait a few minutes longer . I will tell him that you are here .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Thank you .HEINRICH crosses to studio door .Wait ! Has anyone called to see your master this morning ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: No , Madame .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Did n't anyone leave a letter for him ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: No , Madame .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , aside Thank God ! Please tell him I 'm here .

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: I 'm afraid , Madame , you will have to wait a moment ; but I will tell the doctor ——

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , quickly What doctor ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: The gentleman who was here with you yesterday .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , aside Dr. Miller ? He — is — in — there ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Yes , Madame .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , aside Then I 'm too late .To HEINRICH , reluctantlyDid you see Dr. Miller give a letter to your master ? A piece of paper ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: Possibly , Madame , but I do n't remember .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Tell Dr. Miller to come at once . Say a lady wishes to speak to him , but do n't give him my name .

div.stage: HEINRICH goes out .
OLGA walks up and down terribly agitated .
DEVIL enters .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Are you the lady who wishes to see me at once ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Oh , tell me — did you — have you ...?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , nods Yes — delivered .OLGA sinks into chair , clasping her hands tightly .Enter HEINRICH , busy with tea things .Put it here . Thank you .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Without looking at the DEVIL .Did he read it ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Yes .

div.stage: Is busy with his tea .
Silence .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: My God !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Now standing behind OLGA , tea cup in his hand .After he read it , he buried his face in the pillow and cried .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: He cried ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I hate men who cry .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I did not want him to have that letter . I wanted to speak to him first . I wanted to ask him to give me my letter back unopened I am too late .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: You were not too late . It 's I that was too early .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: He cried ?

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: From joy .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I have n't the courage to speak to him , and yet I feel that I must . I would like to go away , but something holds me ; something I cannot — I cannot — oh , what will become of me ?

sp.speaker: HEINRICH
sp.p: , at door My master will be here in a moment , sir .

div.stage: HEINRICH goes out .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I must be going .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Do n't go ! Please stay . I do n't want to be alone with him .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: But if I am here you cannot speak to him about the letter . I shall only be in the way .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , very weak Very well , then , I shall speak to him quite frankly . I shall ask him for the last time —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , voice from the studio Heinrich !

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , quick There he is .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , very weak Please stay .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , pointing to the small door at L . I shall be here . If you need me , call .

div.stage: DEVIL goes out .
KARL comes in from the studio .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , kisses OLGA 'S hand passionately Olga ! I ought to go on my knees and beg your pardon for what I did last night .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Speak low — Dr. Miller is in there .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Olga — can you ever ——

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: No , no ; it is I who should ask forgiveness I was to blame . I lost control of myself . After what happened , I wanted to know — I wanted to make sure — but , you understand now , my letter has told you everything .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What letter ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , reproachfully Karl , I understand . You want to spare me — you 're being discreet ; but you do n't know me ; I mean every word of that letter , I 'm glad I wrote it ——

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: But I did n't get any letter .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Did n't Doctor Miller give you a letter ?

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: No , no ; really .

div.stage: Illustration : Olga and Karl

lg.stage: Angry and almost crying , crossing to door .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Ah , pardon me , Madame , a thousand pardons , I quite forgot . The only excuse I can offer is that there are some letters which ought never to be delivered .

div.stage: Takes letter out of his pocket

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Takes a step towards KARL , looks at DEVIL over her shoulder , shivers slightly .Who is that man ?Silence , KARL looks at DEVIL , OLGA is terrified .DEVIL crosses , gives the letter to KARL with a smile .OLGA , quickly , to KARL .Tear that letter up .KARL tears up letter .Put it in the fire .

div.stage: KARL crumples up the pieces and throws them in the fire . As he does so , OLGA makes an involuntary movement with her hand as if to stop him , but he does not see it as his back is turned . The DEVIL sees it , however , and smiles

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: I sincerely regret if my forgetfulness has caused any inconvenience

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , at alcove , pointing to door ROffensively .Pray do n't let me detain you —

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: My train does n't leave for an hour . Once more a thousand pardons .Crossing to C ., turning to both .If I could have foreseen what terrible distress the non-delivery of this letter ——

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , firmly You may be quite sure it contained nothing — er — nothing —

div.stage: At a loss for a word .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , looking at OLGA Nothing .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , at large chair You will miss your train .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to OLGA , bowing Madame —To KARL , offering hand .KARL turns his back .Good-bye , a thousand pardons .

div.stage: Exit DEVIL at door to hall .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I would have given anything in the world if you had not burned that letter .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Why — you told — me —OLGA shrugs her shoulders as if to say , “ What can one expect of a man ? ”What does it matter anyway , whatever it is ? I would rather hear it from your lips .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , firmly No ! The letter is burned ; it is nothing but ashes — it is dead — no human power can bring it back to life .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: But , Olga !

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: A moment ago I would have given all I possessed to save it from the fire — and now —

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: What has happened ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I can n't tell you . I only know I am glad — I 'm glad .

div.stage: OLGA here seems to have suddenly become composed , almost happy , as if something had been settled , though not as she had wished , still it is a relief .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , takes her hand Olga , do you mean you will never —

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: , smiling I mean you will never know what was in that letter — it is as if it had never been written — it has ceased to exist , and we are past the day of miracles .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: , impatiently Miracles ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: No , no ! Only the devil himself would re-create that letter from its burnt ashes . Good-bye , Karl . I 'm going now — I sha n't see you again .

div.stage: Shakes hands naturally .

At word “ Devil ” the DEVIL enters silently from hall door . He has his fur coat on . He smiles wickedly , and at OLGA 'S words “ re-create that letter , ” pulls OLGA 'S letter out of his pocket , and stands so that the chair hides him from KARL and OLGA , who are close to studio door .

sp.speaker: KARL
sp.p: Olga , you are afraid of something . What is it ?

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: I 'm afraid of — myself — good-bye !

lg.stage: They turn and see the devil .

div.stage: Goes abruptly into the studio , OLGA stands as if hypnotized .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: , to OLGA I beg your pardon , I am so upset to-day —Holding out letter .I made a mistake — I gave you my tailor 's bill instead of your letter — here is your letter !

div.stage: DEVIL gives the letter to OLGA , who snatches it from him in a frightened manner and tears it open . She recognizes her letter .

sp.speaker: OLGA
sp.p: Karl ! my letter ! I have my letter —

div.stage: She runs into the studio .
The DEVIL goes to the door of the studio , smiles diabolically , listens a minute at the door and rubs his hands as if he was very pleased with himself .

sp.speaker: DEVIL
sp.p: Voila !

div.stage: CURTAIN .
